description: Functions to access the file system of a connection and to interact with file handles. File handle instances to files allow operations such as reading, writing, and seeking in a file.

comment.description: Get a file system instance associated with the given client context.
comment.return_value: The resulting file system instance. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_file_system`.

comment.description: Destroys the given file system instance.

param_comments.file_system: The file system instance to destroy.

comment.description: Retrieves the last error that occurred on the given file system instance.
Opens a file at the given path with the specified options.

param_comments.options: The file open options specifying how to open the file.
param_comments.out_file: The resulting file handle instance, or `nullptr` if the open failed. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_file_handle`.

comment.return_value: Whether the operation was successful. If not, the error data can be retrieved using `duckdb_file_system_error_data`.

comment.description: Creates a new file open options instance with blank settings.
comment.return_value: The new file open options instance. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_file_open_options`.

comment.description: Sets a specific flag in the file open options.

param_comments.flag: The flag to set (e.g., read, write).
param_comments.value: If the flag is enabled or disabled.

comment.return_value: `DuckDBSuccess` on success or `DuckDBError` if the flag is unrecognized or unsupported by this version of DuckDB.

comment.description: Destroys the given file open options instance.

param_comments.options: The file open options instance to destroy.

comment.description:
Destroys the given file handle and deallocates all associated resources.
This will also close the file if it is still open.
Retrieves the last error that occurred on the given file handle.
comment.return_value: The error data. Must be destroyed with `duckdb_destroy_error_data`

comment.description: Reads data from the file into the buffer.

param_comments.file_handle: The file handle to read from.
param_comments.buffer: The buffer to read data into.
param_comments.size: The number of bytes to read.

comment.return_value: The number of bytes actually read, or negative on error.

comment.description: Writes data from the buffer to the file.

param_comments.file_handle: The file handle to write to.
param_comments.buffer: The buffer containing data to write.
param_comments.size: The number of bytes to write.

comment.return_value: The number of bytes actually written, or negative on error.

comment.description: Tells the current position in the file.

param_comments.file_handle: The file handle to tell the position of.

comment.return_value: The current position in the file, or negative on error.

comment.description: Gets the size of the file.

param_comments.file_handle: The file handle to get the size of.

comment.return_value: The size of the file in bytes, or negative on error.

comment.description: Seeks to a specific position in the file.

param_comments.file_handle: The file handle to seek in.

comment.return_value: `DuckDBSuccess` on success or `DuckDBError` on failure. If unsuccessful, the error data can be retrieved using `duckdb_file_handle_error_data`.

comment.description: Synchronizes the file's state with the underlying storage.
comment.return_value: `DuckDBSuccess` on success or `DuckDBError` on failure. If unsuccessful, the error data can be retrieved using `duckdb_file_handle_error_data`.
`DuckDBSuccess` on success or `DuckDBError` on failure. If unsuccessful, the error data can be retrieved using `duckdb_file_handle_error_data`.
